basics.name: Ali Momeni
basics.label: ML Researcher
basics.summary: Passionate in Analog AI, Learning algorithms, on-device training, analog AI accelerators, neuromorphic computing, and physics-informed machine learning.

work.name: AICD - Sony AI
work.summary: Contributed to cutting-edge machine learning projects in AI for Chip Design.
highlights: Developed locality-aware surrogate models using the GradPI loss function.
Designed reinforcement learning methods for synthesizing integrated circuits.
Created a large language model (LLM) for netlist-to-schematic conversion.
Skills: Reinforcement learning, optimization, Python (PyTorch), Git, and cloud services.

work.name: LWE - EPFL
work.summary: Conducting research in analog computing, AI/ML, and interdisciplinary big data projects.
highlights: Pioneered training analog models with different learning algorithms
Skills: Solving optimization problems, Python with PyTorch, TensorFlow, NumPy, Matplotlib, Pandas, Scikit-learn.

education.institution: Iran University of Science and Technology (IUST)
courses: Neuromorphic and Analog Optical Computing Systems

projects.name: GradPI
projects.summary: Locality-aware surrogate models (GradPI loss function) for black-box online optimization and training.

projects.name: GraCo
projects.summary: A Graph Composer for Integrated Circuits.
highlights: Designed a reinforcement learning-based method for IC synthesis.

projects.name: ForwardFormer
projects.summary: Local, Forward‑only training of Transformer models without backward passes.

projects.name: PhyLL
projects.summary: Physical Local Learning of deep Physical Neural Networks (PNNs) without backpropagation.
highlights: Collaborated with Microsoft and CNRS to develop Model-free Forward-Forward algorithm.
Enabled in-hardware training and inference without traditional backpropagation.

projects.name: Analog Neuroacoustic Computing
projects.summary: Neuromorphic computing directly with sound waves for speech recognition tasks.
highlights: Implemented physics-inspired recurrent neural networks and reservoir computing.
Leveraged nonlinear sound scattering in real-world environments without pre-processing.

projects.name: Time-varying Optical Neural Networks
projects.summary: First Time-varying optical neural networks (ONNs) enabling power-efficient wave-based analog deep learning.
highlights: Proposed unique time-varying entanglement in ONNs.
Published research recognized as one of the top 50 latest Nature papers in Applied Physics and Mathematics.
